  • |Table tag
  • Latest release: 0.9.0

Table tag

Usage

The table tag allows you to display a HTML table thanks to a set of attributes and nested <datatables:column> tags.

You can either use a "DOM" source, i.e. a Java collection previously set in the page or request scope or an "AJAX" source, i.e. using a web service that must return data formatted in JSON. 

<datatables:table id="myTableId" data="${myCollection}" ...>
   <datatables:column title="Id" property="id" />
   <datatables:column title="FirstName" property="firstName" />
   <datatables:column title="LastName" property="lastName" />
   <datatables:column title="City" property="address.town.name" />
   <datatables:column title="Mail" property="mail" />
</datatables:table>
You will find in the bellowing table all the available attributes for this tag.

Note that:

  • you can also use dynamic attributes, i.e. attributes that are not officially declared in the TLD. This is convenient especially for all native HTML attributes. 
    <datatables:table cellspacing="5" ...>
   ...
</datatables:table>
  • you can use expression language (EL) in all attributes. 
    <datatables:table info="${...}" ...>
   ...
</datatables:table>

Reference

Name Description Value(s) Default value Data source compatibility Corresponding configuration name
id (required) DOM id of the HTML table DOM AJAX n/a
data (Either data or url attribute is required) Collection of data used to populate the table DOM n/a
url (Either data or url attribute is required) URL that will be called by DataTables to populate the table AJAX n/a
row Name under with the object representing the current row is added to the pageContext, allowing you to access the object in the body of a <datatables:column> tag. If data must be displayed without any decoration, use the property attribute of the column tag DOM n/a
appear Allows to change the display mode used when the table has finished loading and must appear in the page. A duration can be set (in milliseconds) if the display mode is set to "fadein" block|fadein[,duration] DOM AJAX extra.appear
cdn Enable the DataTables source files to be loaded from the Microsoft CDN (Content Delivery Framework) preventing you from hosting the files yourself. true|false false DOM AJAX extra.cdn
cssStyle DOM AJAX css.style
cssClass CSS class(es) applied on the HTML table (HTML class attribute) DOM AJAX css.class
rowIdBase Useful if you want each row has a DOM id. This attribute is evaluated as a property of the current iterated bean (Only if DOM datasource) DOM n/a
rowIdPrefix String which is prepended to the rowIdBase attribute, in order to build row id (HTML id attribute) DOM n/a
rowIdSufix String which is appended to the rowIdBase attribute, in order to build row id (HTML id attribute) DOM n/a
info Enable or disable the table information display. This shows information about the data that is currently visible on the page, including information about filtered data if that action is being performed true|false true DOM AJAX feature.info
paginate Enable or disable pagination true|false true DOM AJAX feature.paginate
lengthChange If paginate is enabled, allows the end user to select the size of a formatted page from a select menu (sizes are 10, 25, 50 and 100) true|false true DOM AJAX feature.lengthChange
paginationType Choice between the different built-in pagination interaction methods which present different page controls to the end user two_button|
full_numbers|
four_button|
bootstrap|
scrolling|
input|
listbox|
extJs 		two_button DOM AJAX feature.paginationType
filter Enable or disable filtering of data true true|false DOM AJAX feature.filter
filterPlaceholder Placeholder used to hold the individual column filtering elements head_before|head_after|foot|none DOM AJAX feature.filterplaceholder
sort Enable or disable sorting of columns. Sorting of individual columns can be disabled by the "sortable" attribute of column tag true|false true DOM AJAX feature.sort
autoWidth Enable or disable automatic column width calculation true|false true DOM AJAX feature.autoWidth
displayLength Number of rows to display on a single page when using pagination 10 DOM AJAX feature.displayLength
processing Enable or disable the display of a 'processing' indicator when the table is being processed (e.g. a sort). This is particularly useful for tables with large amounts of data where it can take a noticeable amount of time to sort the entries true|false false AJAX ajax.processing
export Comma-separated list of allowed export types csv|xml|pdf|xls|xlsx DOM AJAX export.types
exportLinks Comma-separated list of positions where the export links will be generated top_left| top_middle| top_right| bottom_left| bottom_middle| bottom_right top_right DOM export.links
jqueryUI Enable jQuery UI ThemeRoller support true|false false DOM AJAX feature.jqueryUi
fixedHeader Enable or disable the DataTables FixedHeader plugin true|false false DOM AJAX plugin.fixedHeader
fixedPosition (fixedHeader) Respectively fix the header, footer, left column, right column top|bottom|left|right top DOM AJAX plugin.fixedPosition
offsetTop (fixedHeader) Offset applied on the top. DOM AJAX plugin.fixedOffsetTop
scroller Enable or disable the DataTables Scroller plugin true|false false DOM AJAX plugin.scroller
scrollX Table's width to display in scrolling mode DOM AJAX feature.scrollX
scrollXInner Use more width than it might otherwise do when x-scrolling is enabled DOM AJAX feature.scrollXInner
scrollY (scroller) Table's height to display in scrolling mode. 300px DOM AJAX feature.scrollY
scrollCollapse When vertical (y) scrolling is enabled, DataTables will force the height of the table's viewport to the given height at all times (useful for layout). However, this can look odd when filtering data down to a small data set, and the footer is left "floating" further down. This parameter (when enabled) will cause DataTables to collapse the table's viewport down when the result set will fit within the given Y height. true|false false DOM AJAX feature.scrollCollapse
colReorder Enable or disable the DataTables ColReorder plugin true|false false DOM AJAX plugin.colReorder
theme Name of a theme to activate for the current table bootstrap2|jqueryui DOM AJAX extra.theme
themeOption Name of an option to activate in relation to the current activated theme. DOM AJAX extra.themeOption
serverSide Configure DataTables to use server-side processing. true|false false AJAX ajax.serverSide
pipelining Enable pipelining data for paging when server-side processing is enabled. true|false false AJAX ajax.pipelining
pipeSize Pipe size used when pipelining is enabled, i.e. times that the user can page before a request must be made of the server. 5 AJAX ajax.pipeSize
cssStripes Comma-separated list of CSS classes that should be applied to displayed rows. This sequence of CSS classes may be of any length, and DataTables will apply each class sequentially, looping when required. DOM AJAX css.stripeClasses
lengthMenu Specify the entries in the length drop down menu that DataTables show when pagination is enabled DOM AJAX feature.lengthMenu
serverData Allows you to override the default function which obtains the data from the server ($.getJSON) so something more suitable for your application AJAX ajax.serverData
serverParams Allows you to send extra information to the server when using AJAX source AJAX ajax.serverParams
deferRender Defer the creation of the table elements for each row until they are needed for a draw true|false false AJAX ajax.deferRender
stateSave Enable or disable state saving. When enabled a cookie will be used to save table display information such as pagination information, display length, filtering and sorting. As such when the end user reloads the page the display display will match what thy had previously set up. true|false false DOM AJAX feature.stateSave
dom Allows you to specify exactly where in the DOM you want DataTables to inject the various controls it adds to the page (for example you might want the pagination controls at the top of the table). DIV elements (with or without a custom class) can also be added to aid styling. lfrtip DOM AJAX feature.dom
ext Comma-separated list of custom extensions to register in the current. Note that the extensions must be scanned using the base.package configuration. DOM AJAX extra.customExtensions
confGroup Name of the configuration group to activate for the current table DOM AJAX n/a

Available values of the themeOption attribute: blacktie , blitzer , cupertino , darkhive , dotluv , eggplant , excitebike , flick , hotsneaks , humanity , lefrog , mintchoc , overcast , peppergrinder , redmond , smoothness , southstreet , start , sunny , swankypurse , trontastic , uidarkness , uilightness , and vader .
